compiler.automaton

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • compiler.automaton.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Supernode

    public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    A scenemaker node.
    Author:
    Max Depenbrock

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String code
      The code that is executed when reaching the Node.
      private java.util.Set<Edge> conditionalEdges
      The set of outgoing (non-interruptive) conditional edges.

      The set of outgoing epsilon edges (empty or a single member).

      The set of outgoing fork edges.

      The set of outgoing interruptive edges.

      A boolean indicating if the Node is a Supernode.

      The parent Supernode of the Node.

      The set of outgoing probability edges.
      private java.util.Set<Edge> timeoutEdges

      A set of variables defined in the Node.

        A boolean indicating whether the Node is a Supernode

        public void setSupernode(boolean isSupernode)
        Parameters:
        isSupernode - A boolean indicating whether this Node should be set as a Supernode

      • processCanDieHere

        public boolean processCanDieHere()
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if a process can die at this (if it has only conditional/interruptive outgoing edges, or none at all)

      • getEdgeCode

        public java.lang.String getEdgeCode(java.util.Set<Edge> edges)
        Parameters:
        edges - A set of edges
        Returns:
        A string containing the VOnDA-code fragment that imitates the functionality of the set of edges

      • getInterruptiveEdgesCode

        public java.lang.String getInterruptiveEdgesCode(java.util.Set<Edge> interruptiveEdges,
                                                 int numLeadingTabs)
        This method should only be called on a simple Node (not on a Supernode) for proper functionality. For Supernodes there exists a corresponding method getSuperInterruptiveEdgesCode.
        Parameters:
        interruptiveEdges - A set of interruptive edges
        numLeadingTabs - Integer indicating how indented (number of tabs) the code should be
        Returns:
        A String containing the VOnDA-code fragment that imitates the functionality of the set of interruptive edges attached to this node

      • getNodeCode

        public java.lang.String getNodeCode()
        Creates the VOnDA-code fragment that imitates the functionality of the Node.
        Returns:
        A String containing the VOnDA-code that imitates the functionality of the Node

      • replaceVarName

        public java.lang.String replaceVarName(java.lang.String varName)
        Changes the name of the given Variable such that it is a field of the correct Supernode object. If no Supernode of which the variable is a field can be found, the name is left unchanged.
        Parameters:
        varName - The name of the Variable that is to be replaced in the code.
        Returns:
        A String containing the variable call in VOnDA syntax, as a field of the appropriate Supernode object

      • convertCodeToRudi

        public java.lang.String convertCodeToRudi()
        Converts the code that is executed when reaching the Node into VOnDA syntax, replacing variables with fields of the appropriate Supernodes.
        Returns:
        A String containing the code that is executed when reaching the Node in VOnDA syntax
